ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

block.text: Los otros discípulos llegaron a la playa con la barca, arrastrando la red llena de pescados, pues estaban a cien metros escasos de la orilla.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Al bajar a tierra, encontraron un fuego encendido, con un pescado encima, y pan.
Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”

block.text: <<Traigan algunos pescados de los que acaban de sacar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn’t torn.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Simón Pedro subió a la barca y arrastró hasta la playa la red llena de grandes pescados, ciento cincuenta y tres; y aunque eran tantos, la red no se rompió.
Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and eat breakfast.”

block.text: <<Vengan a desayunarse.

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.

block.text: Ninguno de los discípulos se atrevía a preguntarle quién era, porque sabían que era el Señor.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

block.text: Luego Jesús se acercó, tomó en sus manos el pan y se lo dio a ellos; y lo mismo hizo con el pescado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

block.text: Esta fue la tercera vez que Jesús se apareció a sus discípulos después de haber resucitado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter,

block.text: Terminado el desayuno, Jesús le preguntó a Simón Pedro:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?”

block.text: <<Simón, hijo de Juan, ¿me amas más que estos?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Pedro le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Sí, Señor, tú sabes que te quiero.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my lambs.”

block.text: <<Cuida de mis corderos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him again a second time,

block.text: Volvió a preguntarle:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?”

block.text: <<Simón, hijo de Juan, ¿me amas?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Pedro le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Sí, Señor, tú sabes que te quiero.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tend my sheep.”

block.text: <<Cuida de mis ovejas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him the third time,

block.text: Por tercera vez le preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?”

block.text: <<Simón, hijo de Juan, ¿me quieres?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said to him,

block.text: Pedro, triste porque le había preguntado por tercera vez si lo quería, le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you!”

block.text: <<Señor, tú lo sabes todo: tú sabes que te quiero.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my sheep.
Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to.

block.text: <<Cuida de mis ovejas.
Te aseguro que cuando eras más joven, te vestías para ir a donde querías;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don’t want to go.”

block.text: pero cuando ya seas viejo, extenderás los brazos y otro te vestirá, y te llevará a donde no quieras ir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him,

block.text: Al decir esto, Jesús estaba dando a entender de qué manera Pedro iba a morir y a glorificar con su muerte a Dios. Después le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<¡Sígueme!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”

block.text: Al volverse, Pedro vio que detrás venía el discípulo a quien Jesús quería mucho, el mismo que en la cena había estado a su lado y le había preguntado: <<Señor, ¿quién es el que te va a traicionar?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus,

block.text: Cuando Pedro lo vio, preguntó a Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what about this man?”

block.text: <<Señor, y a este, ¿qué le va a pasar?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”

block.text: <<Si quiero que él permanezca hasta que yo vuelva, ¿qué te importa a ti? Tú sígueme.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn’t die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to him that he wouldn’t die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”

block.text: Por esto corrió entre los hermanos el rumor de que aquel discípulo no moriría. Pero Jesús no dijo que no moriría. Lo que dijo fue: <<Si quiero que él permanezca hasta que yo vuelva, ¿qué te importa a ti?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

block.text: Este es el mismo discípulo que da testimonio de estas cosas, y que las ha escrito. Y sabemos que dice la verdad.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn’t have room for the books that would be written.

block.text: Jesús hizo muchas otras cosas; tantas que, si se escribieran una por una, creo que en todo el mundo no cabrían los libros que podrían escribirse.
